thread.title: Iceland’s Hordur Magnusson proves too much for Ireland’s second string
thread.title_full: Iceland’s Hordur Magnusson proves too much for Ireland’s second string

author: Guardian sport and Press Association
title: Iceland’s Hordur Magnusson proves too much for Ireland’s second string
text:
Friendlies Iceland’s Hordur Magnusson proves too much for Ireland’s second string Hordur Magnusson, right, scores Iceland’s winning goal from a free-kick against Republic of Ireland. Photograph: Brian Lawless/PA Iceland’s Hordur Magnusson proves too much for Ireland’s second string View more sharing options Guardian sport and Press Association Tuesday 28 March 2017 22.11 BST Last modified on Tuesday 28 March 2017 22.41 BST 
Hordur Magnusson’s first-half free-kick was enough to give Iceland a 1-0 friendly victory over a second-string Republic of Ireland side in Dublin. 
The Bristol City defender curled home a 21st-minute free-kick as Martin O’Neill’s side spluttered through the first half before belatedly finding a rhythm. 
However, they were unable to make the pressure tell and slipped to a first defeat at the Aviva Stadium for three years. 
Robbie Brady returned from suspension to captain a team in which only Jeff Hendrick and James McClean survived from Friday’s 0-0 World Cup qualifier draw with Wales. 
Four players were given their debut – Andy Boyle, Conor Hourihane, John Egan and Daryl Horgan, the former Dundalk goalscorer who, like Boyle, now plays for Preston North End and came on in the second half to a huge welcome. 
Shane Long and Callum O’Dowda were also thrown into the mix as James McClean and Aiden McGeady made way, and the home side went close with 17 minutes remaining when Horgan picked up possession wide on the left and sent over a cross which eluded the Iceland goalkeeper, Ogmundur Kristinsson, but did not fall for a green shirt. 
Ireland finished in the ascendancy but were only able to muster a series of half-chances that were snuffed out by the visitors who managed to hang on with little difficulty. Topics
